program_name: Master of Engineering (MEng) in Chemical Engineering

level_constraints.description: No more than 2 may be 500 level courses.

departmental_constraints.description: Of the 7 electives, 4 must be CHE courses.

grade_requirements.description: Minimum cumulative average of 70%. Minimum grade of 65% in each individual course.

additional_constraints.description: No more than 1 may be a reading course. Only courses taken within five years prior to the completion of the MEng degree may be counted for credit.

requirements.description: CHE 600 Engineering and Research Methods, Ethics, Practice, and Law (0.25 credit weight)
Either CHE 601 Theory and Application of Transport Phenomena or CHE 602 Chemical Reactor Analysis
7 graduate level electives of which 4 must be CHE courses. Subject to level and reading course constraints.

specializations.name: Biological Engineering
specializations.description: Graduate Specialization consisting of 4 graduate (0.50 weight) level courses with mix of compulsory and elective courses.

requirements.description: Compulsory courses: CHE 562 Advanced Bioprocess Engineering, CHE 660 Principles of Biochemical Engineering, CHE 663 Bioseparations
Choose 1 from elective list: CHE 561 Biomaterials & Biomedical Design, CHE 564 Food Process Engineering

specializations.name: Entrepreneurship
specializations.description: Graduate Specialization requiring approval from Chemical Engineering Graduate Officer.
special_requirements: Students must obtain approval from the Chemical Engineering Graduate Officer
Students required to submit a short proposal following matriculation describing their entrepreneurship idea and suitability to pursue it

requirements.description: All 4 compulsory courses: BE 600 Management and Leadership, BE 605 Project Management, BE 606 Entrepreneurship and Innovation, CHE 651 Technology Entrepreneurship Project

specializations.name: Polymer Science and Engineering
specializations.description: Graduate Specialization with 2 compulsory and 2 elective courses.

requirements.description: Compulsory courses: CHE 541 Introduction to Polymer Science and Properties, CHE 621 Model Building and Response Surface Methodology
Choose 2 from: CHE 543 Polymer Production: Polymer Reaction Engineering, CHE 640 Polymer Property Characterization, CHE 641 Fundamentals of Polymer Processing Operations

specializations.name: Process Systems Engineering
specializations.description: Graduate Specialization with 2 compulsory and 2 elective courses.

requirements.description: Compulsory courses: CHE 620 Applied Engineering Mathematics, CHE 621 Model Building and Response Surface Methodology
Choose 2 from: CHE 520 Process Flowsheet Analysis, CHE 521 Process Optimization, CHE 522 Advanced Process Dynamics and Control

seminar_attendance.description: Over the course of their degree program, all students must attend 12 seminars from departments and research institutions where Chemical Engineering faculty members have a membership.
seminar_attendance.documentation_note: At Chemical Engineering seminars, attendance is documented. At other approved seminars, students must complete an attendance form and get it signed by the seminar organizer.

additional_information.funding: Applicants to the MEng program are expected to be entirely self funded. No financial assistance will be provided from the Department of Chemical Engineering or the University of Waterloo.
additional_information.specialization_limit: Students are limited to one Graduate Specialization designation for their MEng in Chemical Engineering degree.
